intro: Euryops annuus, commonly known as the African daisy, is an annual flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, narrow leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Euryops annuus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
